thread.title: More than 300 whales escape after becoming stranded on New Zealand beach
thread.title_full: More than 300 whales escape after becoming stranded on New Zealand beach

author: Patrick Grafton-Green
title: More than 300 whales escape after becoming stranded on New Zealand beach
text:
Hamburg airport evacuated after 50 people suffer breathing problems 
More than 300 whales have escaped after becoming stranded on a beach in New Zealand . 
Some 650 whales became stranded over the last few days in two separate incidents at Farewell Spit on South Island. 
The first, on Thursday, was one of the worst beaching cases in New Zealandâ€™s history, with more than 400 pilot whales becoming trapped. 
Shocking photos emerged showing the whales stranded, and more than 70 per cent had died by sunrise on Friday morning. Beached: Shocking images showed more than 400 whales became trapped on Thursday 
However hundreds of conservation staff and local volunteers managed to refloat about 100 of the whales. 
On Saturday, another 200 whales which became stranded were able to refloat themselves overnight without the help of volunteers. 
It is not clear why the whales continue to arrive on the three-mile long beach, but it is now hoped the spate of strandings is over. More about:
